overview.short: Moraxella catarrhalis is a Gram-negative, oxidase-positive, asaccharolytic short rod/coccobacillus that is a common respiratory pathogen.
overview.clinical_context: Frequently causes otitis media and sinusitis in children, and bronchitis/COPD exacerbations and pneumonia in adults.

species_markers.notes: DNase positivity supports M. catarrhalis identification in respiratory isolates.
Commonly nitrate-reducing; useful with oxidase positivity and asaccharolytic profile.
Often positive; supports species-level separation from some other Moraxella.

common_confusions.reason: Oxidase-positive Gram-negative organisms with diplococcal/coccobacillary appearance.
Coccobacillary Gram-negative morphology; oxidase helps differentiate.

when_to_question_identification: Oxidase-negative result argues against M. catarrhalis.
Clear carbohydrate fermentation argues against M. catarrhalis (asaccharolytic).
Marked haemolysis suggests an alternative respiratory organism.

recommended_next_tests.reason: Rapid confirmatory test highly supportive of M. catarrhalis.
Useful biochemical panel for Neisseria/Haemophilus/Moraxella group confirmation.
High-confidence species confirmation and differentiation from Neisseria-like organisms.
